Batman of England
deck: The original Squire to the Shining Knight (Sir Justin), Percy grew up and became the first Knight with his son Cyril as his Squire. After his death, Cyril took up the mantle of Knight.
description:
Origin

Percy Sheldrake was only 20 years of age when his mother was killed in the bombing raid in London and his father was captured during the Dunkirk Evacuation. The Shining Knight failed to save Percy's parents, so he took Percy as his Squire. Percy received enchanted armor from the Shining Knight. This armor would protect him from swords and projectiles. He taught Percy, so that one day Percy would be a knight. Percy fought alongside the Shining Knight for the rest of WWII. He was also on a team of younger superheroes known as the Young Allies. They fought in Europe until their differences pulled them apart. Percy eventually gained enough skill to advance in his rank to become the Knight, taking his son, Cyril, as his Squire.

Percy is killed when he faces his nemesis Springheeled Jack. He is forces to swallow a bomb and his son takes the mantle of the Knight.

Creation

Percy Sheldrake, the original Knight, first appeared in December of 1950 in Batman #62 created by Bill Finger and drawn by Dick Sprang. In later comics, Roy Thomas and Michael Bair are responsible for creating his backstory as the first Squire.

first_appeared_in_issue.name: The Secret Life Of The Catwoman!

issue_credits.name: Batman: The Black Casebook (The stories that inspired Batman R.I.P.)
Armageddon '42; Atom and Evil! Part V
The Secret Life Of The Catwoman!

name: Percy Sheldrake

volume_credits.name: Tales of the Batman: J.H. Williams III

deck: Grand Elder Guru was the leader and father of all the Namekians
description:
After the great cataclysm and drought on Namek, Guru was one of two survivors of the race (the other being the Nameless Namekian who would become Kami and King Piccolo). Guru would repopulate the race of Namekians himself, being every Namekian's father. He would serve as their beloved Grand Elder.

Guru is the creator of the Namekian Dragon Balls and the eternal dragon Porunga.

When Frieza attacked Namek looking for the Dragon Balls, Guru amplified the hidden powers in Krillin, Gohan and Dende. The grief of having lost all his children caused him to die prematurely. In a gambit by King Kai, it was arranged for the Earth dragon Shenron to restore the lives of the Namekians Frieza killed. When this happened, Guru was revived.

Guru and the other Namekians were wished to Earth to be saved from Namek's destruction. Before he passed a natural death, he made Elder Moori the Grand Elder of the Namekians.
name: Guru

deck: This criminal is the leader of a gang of inmates in Cell Block 10.  They trick Captain America, take his shield and throw him behind bars.
description:
Other than being shorter in height, the Deacon resembles the evil bald-headed man from the Poltergeist films.

Deacon also appears in Captain America 260, in which he tries to organize a escape from Riker's Island to coincide with Cap's breakout (which was arranged to test the security of the prison). However, Deacon and the other inmates find themselves physically unable to duplicate Cap's actions and are captured by the prison guards.

aliases:
Ma Malai
Rachel Beck
The Angel of Death
deck: Rachel Beck is one of the original witches of Manson.
description:
Origin

Born in the 18th century, Bryn Erin McKenna was a young girl with a special gift. Scouted by Lilith to be her apprentice, Bryn's parents didn't let her go because they deemed Lilith to be a witch. When suddenly the witchhunt began, Bryn was targeted. Her friend James Scott warned her about this. Before James could return to get his sister Mary, who was also targeted, Bryn asked him if he would do something for her. She had borrowed a vial from Lilith. In it was the supposed sap from the first tree on Earth. A sip from it would mean they became immortal. Sceptic about it, James wanted to leave, but was hit by a stray bullet from the militia. Fearing she would lose him, Bryn forced James to take a sip.

Upon capture, Bryn was taken to the woods by three men. When they returned from the woods, she was dead. They threw her body on the pyre, leaving her to burn.

Five generations later, the spirit of Bryn Erin inhabits the body of Rachel Beck. Rachel was murdered by an unknown assailant and buried in a shallow grave in the hills where Bryn was killed. Rachel came back to life. Again confronted by Lilith and asked to be one of her apprentices, Rachel claimed not knowing her past life.
name: Rachel Beck

volume_credits.name: Rachel Rising: The Shadow of Death

deck: Bionika is a cyborg of superhuman capacities.
description:
A Black and White Spanish comic book, "Bionika" was kind of a combination of "The Bionic Woman" and "Knight Rider". The title character was a former female athlete, bionically enhanced due to a car accident. She and her talking car (named "CAR"!) drove around the world fighting crime.

She is of exceptional beauty and does not hesitate to use her extraordinary skills when necessary. In addition to superhuman strength with her legs and her left arm, she has a bionic ear and a bionic eye.
name: Bionika

deck: Character from Life with Archie.
description:
He was Archie best friend at seven until his family had leave Riverdale

Archie Married with Betty Future

After leaving Riverdale his parents divorced he moved to New York, his mother died in a car accident and he lived with his grand mother. Many people though he was crazy talking about his imaginary adventures with Archie. He was very bitter and angry seeing none of his dreams coming true until he meet up with Archie again. Due to his bleak life he is easily annoyed with others stating that their lives are miserable. He helped Archie by addressing the good thing he had. Archie helped make his restaurant into rock club, but unfortunately, Mr. lodge made sure it did not happen by calling New Yorks department of buildings, consumers affairs and health. They violated several 22 health code regulations and did not meet up building code standards. It was foreclosed before it could have begun.
name: Ambrose Pipps

deck: No Tolerance for Intolerance! A.K.A. Chief Challenger.
description:
Origin

Having, along with thousands of other Americans, participated in taking down fascism in Europe Bill Day is dishearten on returning home to find that it is alive, well and active in the States.

Deciding to do something about it he calls himself the Challenger and travels the nation fighting American Fascists, race haters, union busters, and hate mongers. He also creates the Challenger Club to bring like minded people together for his cause.

Having no special skills or abilities The Challenger just shows up where he finds himself need and keeps at it until he makes a difference. At the conclusion of which he has a tendency to then make a speech.

Creators

The Challenger was the featured character of a short lived comic with an unusual theme, the promotion of tolerance and fighting prejudice.

issue_credits.name: Who is America's number one fascist fighter?

name: The Challenger

deck: Created by Robotnik he was made to rule Downunda
description:
Crocobot battled the Downunda Freedom Fighters but he was ready overthrow Robotnik. Even being broken apart can he can still function.

After the nuclear explosion caused by Guru Emu and Tails stopping his escape what was left of his body was repaired and combined with a tank. When his body was destroyed again by Downunda Freedom Fighters during Endgame he used mind control on Duck Bill Platypus to repair himself. He was spotted by Sonic, Tails and the Downunda Freedom Fighters where he was send to prison. After a year he was combined with another robot named Octobot which he was later named Crococtobot, a name that Sonic cannot take seriously, even when Crococtobot was attacking him. Although he was defeated by Sonic, Shadow, and Scourge it is unknown that he had survived the outcome as he stated I still function.

description:
Brief History

Sajani, creator of an artificial Vibranium called Reverbium, works with Peter Parker at Horizon Labs where she is a member of the Lucky Seven.

Throughout her career at Horizon, she has been through various events, such as Spider-Island and getting bit by Morbius, which would have turned her into a vampire if not for her fellow geniuses. During the Goblin attack Sajani developed a cure for the Goblin Formula and was able to transform Carlie Cooper back to her human form.

aliases:
Finn the Human
Finn the Hero
King of the Goblins
Magic Fist
Princess of Rad Hats
Princess Finn
deck: A young human boy with an awesome hat who lives in the magical Land of Ooo. With his best friend Jake the Dog, Finn lives for adventure and princess saving. What time is it? Adventure Time!
description:
History

Finn is perhaps the only full human in the Land of Ooo. He was raised by his best friend Jake's parents, and is highly skilled in combat, although his most common tactic is a straight forward assualt. Finn combats the evil Ice King on a near daily basis. Adventuring is what Finn lives for, taking on any quest or challenge. Finn lives in a tree house with Jake, and they have a ridiculous amount of treasure just laying around from their adventuring. He is immensely brave, has a strong sense of justice, and is fiercely loyal to his friends. Finn often expresses affections towards Princess Bubblegum, until he started to date Flame Princess. Although they had a rocky start to their friendship, Finn is also close with Marceline the Vampire. Finn also owns a sentient video game system, BMO.

Creation

Finn the Human first appears as a cartoon character on the Cartoon Network show Adventure Time with Finn and Jake. He was created by Pendleton Ward, show creator. His first appearance in an episode was in the Pilot episode which screened in 2008.

His first appearance in comics was under the comics publisher Boom! Studios, in the comic book Adventure Time. This issue penned by Ryan North with art by Shelli Paroline and Braden Lamb.

Abilities and Equipment

Finn is an excellent fighter, both with swords and in unarmed combat. He is surprisingly strong and agile for his age, and possesses some skill in magic that he gained in his adventures. Finn can make his arms and legs bend in inhuman ways, is a great video game player, has a good singing voice, is skilled in making origami, and is ambidextrous.

Finn's first sword was an ancient golden sword. He has used numerous other swords over time, and has also utilized crossbows. His most recent sword is his Demon Blood Sword given to him by his and Jake's dad Joshua.

In Other Media

On television, the voice of Finn is provided by Jeremy Shada.

aliases:
Jake the Dog
Magic Fist
Randy Butternubs
Groucho
deck: Jake the Dog is Finn's best friend and constant companion. Jake also acts as a guide for Finn sometimes, since he is older (28 in magical dog years). Living for adventure, Jake is one awesome dude.
description:
Origin

Jake is a magical dog and Finn's constant companion, best friend, and brother by adoption. Jake has stretchy powers, which allow him to stretch and manipulate his body, coming in handy on many occasions throughout his and Finn's adventures. He is the son of Joshua and Margaret, who adopted Finn the Human when he was a baby, he also has a brother named Jeremy. Jake is 28 in magical dog years, but he rarely acts maturely, acting similar to the 14-year old Finn. Both he and his girlfriend, Lady Rainicorn, share a passion for playing the viola. Recently him and Lady had 5 Rainicorn/Dog pups by the names of T.V, Charlie, Viola, Jake Jr, and Kim Kil Whan. Jake had a fear of vampires before he and Finn got to know Marceline.

Creation

Jake was created by Pendleton Ward.

Powers and Abilities

Jake possesses magical "stretchy" powers, allowing him to stretch and morph his body any way he wishes. He can extend his legs over long distances, and shape shift into various forms (such as a parachute or a suit of armor for Finn). He is also able to rearrange his eternal organs. He also stated that he can stretch forever but this was proven untrue. Eventually if he over exerts his abilities his body thins out and he'll die.

Jake can dance, once showing a dancing bug "how it's done."

Longevity: Jake states that he will probably live another hundred years.

Ventriloquism: Jake is fantastic at creating people out of his body who are seeminglyreal and he is able to project his voice as if to come from the fake person.

Music: Jake is called the "musical one" by Finn and can play the violin.

In Other Media

In the animated series Adventure Time, Jake is portrayed by the voice actor John DiMaggio.

deck: Lupagar is a white wolf who can transform into woman at daylight.
description:
Origin

Lupagar changed from woman to wolf at night to hunt for food, but she was captured by a man named Torvath. Torvath locked Lupagar into his castle during night and during day he came and forced himself on her. She managed to claw herself out of the cell and stalked Torvath. She manged to trap him in one room and waited for the nightfall. Torvath was certain that Lupagar wouldn't hurt him, because the white wolves only fed on animals and never on humans. But Lupagar said that Torvath actions were even below animal level and attacked him.
name: Lupagar

deck: A criminal in Gotham who is able to change his face.
description:
Creation

Snakeskin was created by Detective Comics writer Tony Daniel. He was first introduced into the DCU after the relaunch of 2011.

Origin

Two years ago, Jack Houston suffered a bad reaction while volunteering his body to a rogue medical research firm. So he hired a lawyer and won himself a payday for his pain and suffering but he gambled away most of the money in less than a month. Within six month Jack lost everything. He found himself in a hole "five million" deep. With every casino owner and loan shark in Gotham City looking for him, he turned to a life of crime. He began using his unique abilities to swindle and rob. Jack became known as Snakeskin, a man able to change his face but not his fingerprints.

Major Story Arcs

Detective Comics: Faces of Death- Penguin

Snakeskin has joined forces with his lover, Jill Hampton. Together the two have killed several small time criminals through out Gotham including Boris Gorky, Raju and Nicolas Pog to name a few. And now they have their eyes set on the Penguin, so after Jill steals a VIP Card from Mr. Mosaic, the pair sneak aboard The Iceberg Casino. Once on board Snakeskin catches, Charlotte Rivers, Jill's sister, snooping around after Jill, and he tries to off her, but Batman steps in. Snakeskin traps Batman and thinks he's killed both the Dark Knight and Charlotte. But when he tells Jill what he's done she beats him within an inch of his life, he pleads with her and she seems to except his apology. She then arms him for his shot at Penguin, but due to her beating Snakeskin's face wouldn't change. He charges after the Penguin anyway but when he pulls the trigger, the gun explodes and takes off his arm. Snakeskin realizes Jill has double crossed him but there is nothing he can do about it.

Later after Jill is caught by the Batman, Snakeskin visits her in jail disguised as George Weaver an attorney hired by her father, and gets revenge on his former lover.

Powers and Abilities

Snakeskin can change his face by just thinking about it. He can apparently regrow severed limbs also.
name: Snakeskin

volume_credits.name: Batman: Detective Comics: Faces of Death

deck: Ron Black was a ace reporter for the Daily Planet. He belongs to the Smallville (TV series) continuity.
description:
Creation

Ron Black was created by Mark Verheiden. The character doesn't belong to the mainstream continuity of the DC Universe and appeared in the Smallville Comics only.

Storyarc

Ron Black was the newest ace reporter for the Daily Planet and he met Chloe Sullivan during her summer internship. Chloe had a crush on Ron but couldn't really talk to him about it. They worked together and he thought Chloe would become a great reporter sometimes.

After some of her research of the criminal CEO of Intertech Edgar Huff, his chief yelled at him, because he think his article is the worst-researched "piece of junk" he ever given to him.

Later, Ron introduced his wife Reyna to Chloe.
name: Ron Black

deck: Harvey Stitch was a Metropolis Mob Boss. He belongs to the Smallville (TV series) continuity.
description:
Creation

Harvey Stitch was created by Mark Verheiden. The character doesn't belong to the mainstream continuity of the DC Universe and appeared in the Smallville Comics only.

Storyarc

Harvey Stitch was a Mob Boss of Metropolis and worked together with Edgar Huff, the CEO of Intertech. After Harvey tried to attack Chloe Sullivan, he was knocked out by Pete Ross.
name: Harvey Stitch

deck: Edgar Huff was the CEO of Intertech. He belongs to the Smallville (TV series) continuity.
description:
Creation

Edgar Huff was created by Mark Verheiden. The character doesn't belong to the mainstream continuity of the DC Universe and appeared in the Smallville Comics only.

Storyarc

Edgar Huff was the CEO of Intertech and worked together with the Mob Boss Harvey Stitch.
name: Edgar Huff

deck: Louis Hill beat a murder rap fifteen years ago. Now he's a filthy "parasite" who caters to and profits from Gotham's lowest common denominator.
description:
Origin

Louis is the desk clerk at the Abbot Transient Motel in Gotham City. He beat a murder rap once sometime before Bruce Wayne became Batman.

Creation

Louis Hill was created by Tony Daniel and Sandu Florea as a criminal of Gotham City. He was frist introduced into the DCU after the relaunch of 2011.

Major Story Arcs

Detective Comics: Faces of Death- Penguin

When Batman came to the Abbot Motel he found Raju's dead body in one of the rooms. He then goes down to the front desk to question Louis. Louis thinks he got the jump on the Batman and pulls a shotgun. He tries to shoot the Batman but shoots his own foot instead. The Batman then stands there while Louis spill his guts about how a woman with an eye patch came in earlier.
name: Louis Hill

volume_credits.name: Batman: Detective Comics: Faces of Death

name: Tolor

deck: Slow to burn, quick on the trigger
description:
Other than artwork by John Severinthere was not much to set this cowboy character apart from the dozens of others in the Golden-Age.

Not to be confused with the Quality Comics character of the same name.

deck: Samar was a by the numbers comic book jungle lord.
description: However the elephants did like him a lot.
name: Samar

deck: He talked to the dead, and kicked their butt when needed.
description:
Origin

Zero the Ghost Detective had the ability to summon the dead as well as interact with them on a physical level, as such he was able to defend the innocent from malevolent spirits.

Creators

As his adventures never lasted more than 5 pages no details such as a back story, how he got his abilities or even a real name were ever revealed.

Powers

Usually Zero did not demonstrate any real magical abilities, though he was the master of many magical artifacts. Zero described himself as an "ally" with death, which gave him powers to battle the supernatural undead. He dispelled ghosts with a mere gesture, and caught glimpses of the future.
name: Zero: Ghost Detective

deck: Raju was a messenger for the wealthier crime families of Gotham City. He was also an informant for the Gotham City Police Department.
description:
Origin

Raju is a messenger for the wealthier crime families of Gotham City and worked also as an informant for the Gotham City Police Department.

Creation

Raju was created by Tony Daniel and Sandu Florea and was introduced into the DCU after the relaunch of 2011.

Major Story Arcs

Dectective Comics: Faces of Death

Dollmaker

Batman tried to get some information about the Dollmaker out of Raju but Raju only heard something about an auction - but Batman don't believed him. Raju tells him also about the Dolmakers hideout and his muscle. Later Raju shows up at the auction and offers to double the highest bid at the request of his employer the Penguin.

Penguin

Batman finds Raju dead in a bath tube, possibly killed by Jill Hampton.
name: Raju

volume_credits.name: Batman: Detective Comics: Faces of Death

deck: Whitney Fordman was Lana Langs first boyfriend and left Smallville to join the United States Marines. He belongs to the continuity of the Smallville TV series, and had a brief cameo in Zach Snyder's Man of Steel film.
description:
Creation

The character of Whitney Fordman was created for the TV series "Smallville" by Alfred Gough and Miles Millar. He was first introduced into the Series in the first episode and left the series after the first season. He was played by the actor Eric Johnson. In the second season, Eric Johnson returned for one episode but at this time he played the character Tina Greer - a shapeshifter who just wanted to hurt Lana Lang. Johnson also returned for one episode of season four - his last time on "Smallville". He was only seen in a flashback.

History ("Smallville" TV Series)

Whitney grew up in Smallville where he worked in the "Fordman Department Store" - a shop which belonged to his family since 1943. Since his youth, he loved football and that made him later the star quarterback of the Smallville High School. He also dated Lana Lang, who he met during this time. For the first time, Whitney was a really bully but after a couple of episodes, Whitney became much friendlier and even befriended Clark Kent (later known as Superman). Before the prom and after the death of his father George, Whitney left Smallville to join the US Marine Corps. He begged Clark to watch over Lana until he will be back.

In the second season, it was revealed that Whitney was killed in the heat of the battle.

Trivia

  • Whitney was the first main character to be killed.
  • Before Eric Johnson was cast as Whitney Fordman, his original name was going to be Whitney Ellsworth.

Other Media

Man of Steel (2013 Movie)

Whitney was in Man of Steel, played by the actor Robert Gerdisch.
name: Whitney Fordman

deck: The clone of Static's sister Sharon Hawkins. She later takes on the name Cassandra Hawkins
description:
Creation

Sharon Hawkin's clone was created by Static Shock writer/Artist Scott McDaniel. She later was named Cassandra Hawkins and showed herself as equal to the original Sharon.
name: Sharon Hawkins Clone

deck: Laurie is a member of the Partridge Family, a family who has formed their own singing group.  She is the oldest daughter and the second oldest of five children overall.
description:
Lovely actress Susan Dey played high school sweetheart Laurie Partridge for 96 episodes and four seasons. The Partridge Family series aired on the ABC Network from 1970-1974. All four seasons of The Partridge Family series are now available on DVD.

Susan also played attorney Grace Van Owen on the popular LA Law series from 1986 to 1992 and she starred in numerous films and guest appearances on television programs. Her most critically acclaimed film was Mary Jane Harper Cried Last Night, where she played an abusive young mother who took out her frustrations on her small child. Susan has appeared on several magazine covers, including in later years that of Orange Coast, People, Redbook and TV Guide. The teen starlet graced the cover of Teen Magazine in January 1971 and her most famous cover was that of Seventeen Magazine in June 1970, just three months before the premiere of The Partridge Family series. Susan also had numerous color pin-up photos that appeared in several teen magazines in the early 1970's.
name: Laurie Partridge

deck: Keith is a member of the Partridge Family.  He is the lead singer in a family that has formed their own singing group.
description: David Cassidy played the role of Keith Partridge for 96 episodes and four seasons from 1970 to 1974, on the ABC television series "The Partridge Family". David's voice and that of Shirley Jones, aka Shirley Partridge, were the ony two voices of the series' stars that were actually used in the songs. An interesting fact is that while Shirley Jones played his mother on the show, she was his step-mother in real life. David was a real teen heartthrob back in the early 1970's. A color picture of him was plastered on the cover of many teen magazines for several years.
name: Keith Partridge

deck: Shirley is the matriarch of the Partridge Family, a family that has formed their own singing group.  She is a widow and the mother of five children: Keith, Laurie, Danny, Tracy and Chris.
description: Actress Shirley Jones played the role of Shirley Partridge for four seasons from 1970 to 1974 on the ABC televsion series, "The Partridge Family". It shoud be noted that on the series Shirley played as the mother of David Cassidy, aka Keith Partridge, while in real life she was his step-mother. Besides being the Partridge Family mom for four years, she is best known for being the female lead in the popular 1955 musical film "Oklahoma".
name: Shirley Partridge

deck: Danny is the middle child in a family of five children.  Together with their widowed mother, they have formed the Partridge Family singing group.
description: Danny Bonaduce played the role of Danny Partridge for four seasons on the ABC television series, "The Partridge Family". The series ran from 1970 to 1974. Danny and his two younger siblings starred in probably the funniest episode of the 94 Partridge Family episodes, "A Tale of Two Hamsters". During this episode, the kids think that they can make money by breeding hamsters. However, the hamsters multiply rather quickly and they have little luck selling them.
name: Danny Partridge

deck: Tracy is the youngest daughter of Shirley Partridge, a widowed mother to five children.  Tracy is also a member of the Partridge Family singing group.
description: Suzanne Crough played the role of Tracy Partridge for 96 episodes over four seasons, from 1970 to 1974, in the ABC television series, "The Partridge Family".
name: Tracy Partridge

deck: Chris is the youngest son of Shirley Partridge, the widowed mother to five children.  Chris is also a member of the Partridge Family singing group.
description: Jeremy Gelbwalks played the part of Chris Partridge in the first season of the ABC Network's Partridge Family televsion show. Brian Forster took over the part of Chris Partridge in Seasons Two, Three and Four.
name: Chris Partridge

deck: Wilson is the Deputy of Beachrock. He is an ally to Aquaman and Mera.
description:
Creation

Deputy Wilson was created by Geoff Johns and Ivan Reis.

Major Story Arcs

The Trench

Deputy Wilson traveled to Curry Lighthouse to ask Aquaman and Mera for help after Beachrock was attacked by the Trench. Wilson claimed to be the sheriff, seeking their aid. They agree to help, but when they get to the crime scene the real sheriff tells them that Wilson is the deputy. The Trench attack again and once again leave with some humans. Aquaman then opens one of the cocoons made by the Trench. Deputy Wilson identifies the dog inside as "Janet Reed's dog". Aquaman and Mera then travel into Mariana Trench to locate the missing people. They manage to defeat the Trench and rescue a large number of the people. Janet Reed was one of the few that didn't make it, so Deputy Wilson returned to the lighthouse to thank Aquaman and Mera and to ask them if they would like to look after the dog who now has no owner. When they accept, he suggests they call it Aquadog.
name: Deputy Wilson

deck: Sheriff Nancy Adams was the sheriff of Lowell County. She was the hard line peace officer who replaced Ethan Miller when he was exposed as corrupt.
description:
Creation

Sheriff Nancy Adams was created for the TV series "Smallville" by Clint Carpenter and Thomas J. Wright. She was the second sheriff of the TV series and first appeard in season two. She was shot and killed in season five.

Nancy Adams was played by the actress Camille Mitchell.
name: Nancy Adams

aliases:
Kassidy Savage
Kass Savage
Kassidy Sage
deck: America's best FBI profiler whose father is the immortal Vandal Savage.
description:
Origin

A daughter of the immortal Vandal Savage, Kassidy's father was arrested when she was ten years old, after he was discovered committing ritualistic human sacrifices to appease his gods, allowing his proclaimed immortality. The shock of everything that had happened lead her mother to die within a year. Kassidy wouldn't see her father for another sixteen years, a stretch time in which she would become an expert FBI profiler, specializing in serial killers.

Creation

Kass Sage was created by writer James Robinson and artist Bernard Chang for an arc in the anthology title, DC Universe Presents.

Major Story Arcs

The Swan-Killer

Sixteen years after Kass last saw her father, a copy-cat serial killer, known as the "Swan-Killer" begins to mimic her father's sacrificial murders from years prior. When Vandal was interviewed by a duo of FBI agents within Belle Reve, he managed to brutally attack the two, in an effort to get the FBI to send him his daughter. Knowing she has to, Kass travels the prison to meet with her father, in an attempt to acquire his help trying to catch the Swan-Killer. The reunion is tense, as the two hadn't seen each other in over a decade. Vandal agrees to help his daughter after he witnesses her kill an escaped inmate with ease, claiming he had to be sure she was a "true Savage." However, Vandal has one requirement in order to help, and that is he needs to see the crime scenes in person. He admits to his daughter that he may very well try to escape, but she has no choice in the matter, as it is the only way he would agree to help. Kass reluctantly agrees to her father's terms, and arranges his temporary release.

first_appeared_in_issue.name: Savage, Part One: Daddy's Little Girl

issue_credits.name: Savage, Part Two: Father's Day Out
Savage, Part One: Daddy's Little Girl

name: Kass Sage

deck: Director of the Tokyo Branch of the Hand.
description:
Origin

Creation

Azuma Goda was created by Jason Aaron for his run on Wolverine.

Major Story Arc

Back In Japan

After ordering Sabretooth to throw Boss Takenaka from a jet plane, Azuma set up a meeting with the heads of the Yakuza. There he kills many of them though a combination of countless Hand ninjas, a rampaging Sabretooth, and confused newly appointed Silver Samurai.

Azuma would escape with his life by teleorting away with Sabretooth and a now beaten Silver Samurai. They would teleport to The Lair of the Mind Ninja, which has acted as the main lair of the Hand for centuries. There Azuma would torture Shin both physically and mentally, until Wolverine and Yukio show up and Wolverine goes berserk and kills most of the ninjas.

This is when Azuma reveals that his plan was to rid the Hand of the ninja and make himself the invisible crime boss of East Asian. This plan seems to be working. He uses Lord Deathstrike to stage his assassination. But then he is double crossed by Sabretooth.

Sabretooth leaves Azuma behind for Wolverine to kill, which happens. Azuma is last seen dead on his condo balcony.
name: Azuma Goda

aliases:
Goat Monk
The Goat
The Goat Devil of Self-Propagation
deck: Horoam'ce is a goat-headed demon. It bonds with a human host to gain physical presence.
name: Horoam'ce

volume_credits.name: Uncanny X-Force by Rick Remender Omnibus

deck: Plainswalker and greatest thief in the Mulitverse.
description:
Origin

Dack is from the town of Drakeston on the plane of Fiora. While Dack was away on Alkabah, his family and friends there were killed by Sifa Grent in a ritual to keep Sifa young and beautiful. Dack has been tracking her ever since.

While on Alkabah Dack was caught stealing and the punishment was his right hand was dipped into boiling hot red dye that has now scared his arm permanently.

While Dack was still in mage school, he and his best friend Marsh were brash and started fights where ever they could. this lead to Marsh being stabbed from behind and Dack learning humility.

Creation

Dack was created as the main character for the 2012 Magic the Gathering comic book series. He is the creation of artist Martin Coccolo and writer Matt Forbeck.

Major Story Arcs

Magic the Gathering

Dack has just stolen the Ancient Fang from the Cult of Rakdos, on the plain of Ravnica, and is being chased by several of the cult's members and a very large dragon like creature. He is able to hide in a tower but runs into a Viashino, who is trying to rob anther man. Trapped Dack escapes by plainswalking to Fiora, but not before the Viashino has a chance to cut him with his tail.

Now safely on Fiora, Dack goes to the local watering hole where he is recognized, not in a good way and is forced to use magic to escape an angry mob. He runs up stairs where he runs into Alessa. After the two exchange pleasantries, Dack leaves her and plainswalks back to Ravinca.

Back at Ravinca, Dack goes to see the healer, Fadka, who heals his Viashino wound. While there she offers to heal is mysterious stained arm, but Dack refuses, claiming he keeps it as a reminder and it keeps him foucused. While Fadka is healing Dack, Vaclav Nosek shows up unannounced, and Dack promises him he will give him the dagger, when he is done with it.

Back at Dack's safe house Dack uses a spell to see what the last owner of the Fang saw. He sees his home town of Drakeston and a woman named Mariel, who is looking for Dack. He sees the owner of the Fang, an old woman named Sifa, kill Mariel and her army kill the townspeople. The last thing he sees is Sifa's face now young once again.

After putting the Fang away Dack heads off to Innistrad to find Sifa and get his revenge.

While in Innistrad, Dack is forced to save a mother and son from a group of vampires, While making their escape the Baron Eckhart Von Falkenrath, corners Dack and he is forced to pull out the Fang. Upon seeing it the Baron flies off. Once Dack gets the family to a safe house he looks into the dagger once again.

This time he sees Sifa's face again and the Baron's also. This time Sifa orders Baron, against his will to kill the people of Drakeston, and hints that she is looking for Dack. Dack now realizes that the dagger can control vampires and that Sifa is close by.

Spell Thief

After Sifa escapes Dack's grasp he fallows her magic trail to Echoir where he is forced to escape the Titan Collector's collection. He is able to planewalk out of Echoir and finds himself back in Drakeston. There he finds the vampire who was in charge the other vampires the night they killed everyone in Drakeston, and by looking into the magic of his sword Dack learns the vampire was forced against his will to kill the towns people. This fact forces Dack to spare the vampire's life.

Dack leaves Drakeston and goes to Talon and pays back Lito, for ruining the barkeeps life, then Dack heads back to Innistrad. There while visiting Ingrid and her father Hermann visited by Sorin Markov who orders him to hand over the The Ancient Fang. Dack complies to save Ingrid's life, and in doing so learns that Sifa is in Grixis. Dack says a quick goodbye Ingrid and planewalks to Grixis.

Once in Grixis, Dack allows himself to get captured by Malfegor's forces and taken to Malfegor's prison. There he learns that Sifa learned to planewalk by the unusual method of torque. Dack then escapes Malfegor's prison know why Sifa is evil but not what she is planning.

Path of Vengeance

Dack returns to Ravnica where he finds Valcav, beaten and left for dead. He takes Valcav to Fadka for some healing. There he runs into Maytov, who informs him that the Cult of Rakdos is looking for him and have put a huge price on his head. Dack leaves Valcav in the care of Fadka and looks for clues on where Sifa is.

Soon Dack realizes he is in over his head and needs the aid of Fadka, Valcav and Maytov to stop Sifa from destroying the Vitu-Ghazi tree and destroying all life on Rivnica. He is able to stop Sifa, by destroying the evil Planeswalker.

Powers
name: Dack Fayden

volume_credits.name: Magic: The Gathering - The Spell Thief
Magic: The Gathering -- Path of Vengeance
Magic: The Gathering, The Complete Collection

deck: The Lord of Sorrow.
description: For practicing forbidden magics Krokwel was sentenced to the Forest of Sorrows for all eternity. It was James Braddock, leader of the Captain Britain Corps, who passed down this sentence. Many years later Krokwel would help Braddock's daughter, Psylocke, save the life of her teammate, Fantomex. However, the cost of Krokwel's assistance was drastic and Psylocke paid dearly for it.
name: Krokwel

volume_credits.name: Uncanny X-Force by Rick Remender Omnibus

deck: An old friend of the Immortal Man who had different views on life of the Apex race.
name: Savage

deck: A product of the Weapon Plus program who has a grudge against Fantomex.
description:
Origin

The Skinless Man is a mutant who possesses elastic, multi-sensory skin. As a lawyer, he allowed his skin to gain him an advantage over his colleagues. He was approached by Father to join the Weapon Plus program in exchange for his silence. Skinless Man was augmented, having his durability enhanced and became Weapon III, killing thousands of Soviets during the Cold War, at times alongside Fantomex. Father sent him to obtain the Orb of Necromancy from Otherworld, though once he reached it, Fantomex attacked from behind and stole it, leaving him to be dealt with by the Captain Britain Corps. James Braddock ordered that his skin be removed but he be left alive. Shortly after, Fantomex stole his skin from Otherworld.

Creation

The Skinless Man was created by Uncanny X-Force writer Rick Remender. Though he can be seen as a statue in #18, he officially made his first appearance in #21.

Major Story Arcs

Otherworld

As Psylocke and Fantomex attempt to escape Otherworld they are stopped by the Skinless Man. He restrains them both and explains who he is to Psylocke. The Skinless Man demands to know where Fantomex has taken his skin, which he reveals he turned into bullets. Then he proceeds to exact his revenge on Fantomex by torturing him starting with cutting off his face, but is interrupted by Psylocke who uses the poison given to her by Krokwel to stop him. He eases his grip on Fantomex, but before the latter can react, the Skinless Man escapes back to Earth through the portal shown to him by Psylocke.

Powers & Abilities

Even after having his skin removed, the Skinless Man was able to teach his muscles to act in the same way. Every muscle sinew in his body is capable of molecular expansion and contraction. This allows him to extend his muscles like tendrils.

issue_credits.name: From the Cradle to the Grave
The World Won't Stop Without You

issues_died_in.name: From the Cradle to the Grave

name: Skinless Man

volume_credits.name: Uncanny X-Force by Rick Remender Omnibus
